law.catch_line: The Secretary, with the advice of the Committee, shall:...
law.text:
The Secretary, with the advice of the Committee, shall:
On or before October 1, 2012, adopt regulations that:
Establish a science-based risk assessment protocol for invasive plants that:
Will serve as a basis for creating a two-tiered regulatory approach for controlling invasive plants in the State; and
Considers the harm, as determined by the Secretary, that invasive plants cause in the State, including:
Govern administrative orders that the Secretary may issue to enforce this subtitle; and
Establish a procedure for the approval required under § 9.5-302 of this subtitle for activities involving tier 1 invasive plants.
On or before October 1, 2013, adopt regulations that:
Establish a list of tier 1 plants and tier 2 plants in accordance with the risk assessment protocol adopted under paragraph (1) of this subsection;
Establish a procedure for classification or declassification of an invasive plant as a tier 1 invasive plant or a tier 2 invasive plant;
Phase in the implementation of the requirements of this subtitle with consideration of the economic impact of these requirements on nurseries, landscapers, plant wholesalers, plant retailers, and any other industry;
Establish a procedure for the disposal of tier 1 plants;
Designate the format, size, and content of the sign required under § 9.5-302(b)(1) of this subtitle; and
Provide for the distribution of a list of tier 2 invasive plants to licensed nurseries, plant dealers, and plant brokers on an annual basis.
